bill_title: revise certain provisions relating to tampering with public water systems and to provide a penalty therefor.

bill_versions.bill_text: FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to revise certain provisions relating to tampering with public water systems and to provide a penalty therefor. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That subdivision (3) of § 49-34-18 be amended to read as follows: (3) "Tampering," damaging, altering, adjusting or in any manner interfering with or obstructing the action or operation of any meter provided for measuring or registering the amount of utility service passing through the meter , or any valve provided for preventing back flow of water into the supply lines, or any other devices owned and maintained by utility ; Section 2. That chapter 49-34 be amended by adding thereto a NEW SECTION to read as follows: It is a Class 2 misdemeanor for any person without lawful authority to connect, disconnect, bypass, or tamper with a back flow preventer installed on a public water system. Nothing in this section affects the right of a water service company to recover any damages caused by the violation of this section. 750 copies of this document were printed by the South Dakota Legislative Research Council at a cost of $.016 per page. . Insertions into existing statutes are indicated by underscores. Deletions from existing statutes are indicated by overstrikes.

FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to revise certain provisions relating to tampering with public water systems and to provide a penalty therefor. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That subdivision (3) of § 49-34-18 be amended to read as follows: (3) "Tampering," damaging, altering, adjusting or in any manner interfering with or obstructing the action or operation of any meter provided for measuring or registering the amount of utility service passing through the meter , or any valve provided by the utility for preventing back flow of water into the supply lines, or any other devices owned and maintained by the utility ; Section 2. That chapter 49-34 be amended by adding thereto a NEW SECTION to read as follows: It is a Class 2 misdemeanor for any person without lawful authority to connect, disconnect, bypass, or tamper with a back flow preventer installed on a public water system. Nothing in this section affects the right of a water service company to recover any damages caused by the violation of this section.
